newsitem.title: CHINA: NTT, China in $40 mln bank payment pact.
newsitem.headline: NTT, China in $40 mln bank payment pact.

text.p: Japan's NTT Data Communications Systems Corp, a unit of NTT Corp, has received a $40 million contract to help build a payment network for China's central bank, the China Daily said on Friday.

The project will include a national processing centre for the payment system in Beijing and a backup centre in Wuxi in the eastern province of Jiangsu, the newspaper said, quoting People's Bank of China (PBC) deputy governor Chen Yuan.

Official newspapers said the work, which will help the central bank monitor the financial system and control money supply, will also include 20 clearing and processing centres at the municipal level and 80 county-level branches.
The three levels of processing centres will be linked and will help the development of a real-time clearing system as well an account management system.

The project will be expanded to include network construction and development of other application systems in other city-level processing centres, the newspaper said. The central bank has yet to decide who will undertake expansion of the network.
